result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelica C. Nelson

defendant.name: Nelson, Angelica C.
defendant.address: S11310 N. Martin Dr., Strum, WI 54770

records.addlTxt:
(8:42 AM cases 22CM64, 22CM230, 22CF595, 22CF922, 22CF1015, 22CF1063 called.) Defendant Angelica C. Nelson does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Angelica C. Nelson. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kelm advises at the defendant's last hearing the defendant was in person and Attorney Kelm was via video. Attorney Kelm advised this date and time was provided to the defendant.
Attorney Kelm also advises the defendant has some cases with Attorney Miller and was in person and Attorney Miller misspoke saying the defendant's next court date is October 3, 2022 at 9:30 am. Attorney Kelm corrected Attorney Miller to advise the hearing was at 8:30 on October 3.
Court orders warrants but warrants will be stayed until October 4, 2022 at noon.

Conditions: 
No contact with co-defendant R.E.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
(Covers 22CF1015, 22CF1063)

ADDRESS INFO for Angelica C. Nelson
Current: S11310 N. Martin Dr., Strum, WI 54770 United States  (Effective: 09-20-2022)
Prior: 709 Broadview Blvd, Eau Claire, WI 54703

(1:50 PM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Angelica C. Nelson in court, in custody. Attorney George E. Miller in court for Angelica C. Nelson. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Miller advises the defendant will be released on a $20,000.00 signature bond.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in case 22CF1015 and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing in case 22CF1063.
State moves to amend $1,000.00 cash bond in 22CF1015 to a $20,000.00 signature bond with same conditions to also apply to case 22CF1063.
Court orders the $1,000.00 cash bond in 22CF1015 is amended to a $20,000.00 signature bond with same conditions and also applies to case 22CF1063.
Attorney Miller requests cases 22CF1015 and 22CF1063 ride along with the defendant's other open pending cases to which the Court orders.
Arraignment in 22CF1015 and Hearing in 22CF1063 scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 8:30 am in Branch 1.

Conditions: 
No contact with co-defendant R.E.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
(Covers 22CF1015, 22CF1063)
Notice of Hearing - *Re-sent to new address on file 09/22/2022

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:28 PM case called. Defendant Angelica C. Nelson in court, in custody without counsel.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant the SPD office is still in the process of securing counsel for the defendant. Defendant advises they have an attorney but they were not able to be present today. Defendant asks for a signature bond citing employment opportunity. State objects with reasoning. 
Court denies the request to modify the cash bond. Defendant makes a statement. Court advises defendant to contact her attorney. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for the preliminary hearings.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward

OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
The defendant is eligible for SPD services.
Despite best efforts, the SPD has not secured representation.

(11:45 AM case called.) Defendant Angelica C. Nelson appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Angelica C. Nelson. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
State requests $1,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Anderson requests signature bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with co-defendant R.E.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
